title: Level 4: The Golden Ratio Challenge
description:
The Fibonacci sequence has a fascinating property: the ratio of consecutive Fibonacci numbers approaches the Golden Ratio (φ ≈ 1.618033988749895).

Consider the Fibonacci sequence from F(1) to F(50). Count how many pairs of consecutive Fibonacci numbers (F(n+1)/F(n)) have a ratio that rounds to EXACTLY 1.618 when rounded to 3 decimal places.

For example:
- F(6)/F(5) = 8/5 = 1.600 (rounds to 1.600, NOT 1.618)
- F(14)/F(13) = 377/233 = 1.618... (rounds to 1.618, COUNTS)

How many such pairs exist from F(1) through F(50)?
